questions.question: What is entrepreneurship?

options.A: All activities carried out by a person to establish and run business enterprises.
options.B: The study of consumer behaviors and preferences.

questions.question: What characterizes entrepreneurs?

options.C: Innovative and able to operate profitably in a business environment.
options.D: Small scale owners with limited resources.

questions.question: What trend is observed regarding students and entrepreneurship?

options.B: Preference for industry jobs over entrepreneurship.
options.C: Increasing exchange of industry jobs for entrepreneurship.

questions.question: What skills make engineers rational candidates for entrepreneurship?
What must fill the gap between technology development and the market?
What do customers buy according to the text?
What type of entrepreneurs are drawn towards innovations?
Which type of entrepreneurs observe an existing successful system and replicate it with improvements?
What characterizes Fabian entrepreneurs?

options.A: Prone to sudden decisions and innovations.
options.B: Careful in their approaches and cautious in adopting changes.
options.C: Drawn towards innovations and invest a lot of time in research and development.
options.D: Do not like change and prefer traditional methods of business.

questions.question: What characterizes drone entrepreneurs?

options.A: Prone to sudden decisions and innovations.
options.B: Drawn towards innovations and invest a lot of time in research and development.
options.C: Careful in their approaches and cautious in adopting changes.
options.D: Do not like change and prefer traditional methods of business.

questions.question: What function of an entrepreneur involves assuming all possible risks of business?
Which entrepreneur's function involves deciding the nature and type of goods to be produced?
What tasks are performed by entrepreneurs regarding managerial functions?

options.A: Arranging finance, purchasing raw materials, and organizing sales.
options.B: Formulating production plans and providing production facilities.
options.C: Assuming the task of personnel management.

questions.question: What does the innovation function of an entrepreneur involve?

options.A: Introducing new products without considering economic viability.
options.B: Conceiving ideas for improving the quality of production.
options.D: Delegating tasks to paid managerial personnel.

questions.question: What is emphasized as one of the key competitive advantages in the 'new economy'?
What does getting to market quickly ensure?

options.A: Lower profits due to rushed production.

questions.question: What is the estimated impact of a 6-month jump on competitors' market entry?

options.C: Three times the profit over the market life of the design.

questions.question: How does the text define innovation?

options.C: Imaginative activity producing original and commercial value outcomes.

questions.question: What did economist Joseph Schumpeter identify as types of innovation in the 1930s?
What distinguishes disruptive innovations from incremental innovations?

options.A: Disruptive innovations introduce minor changes to existing technology.
options.B: Incremental innovations are radical changes that obsolete previous technology.
options.C: Disruptive innovations have no precedent and significantly alter existing markets.
options.D: Incremental innovations are slower to gain market acceptance.

questions.question: According to the entrepreneural manual, How is the commercialization process likened?
What marks the beginning of the innovation process?
How is an opportunity defined?

options.A: An idea and an unserved market need.
options.B: A new invention without market analysis.
options.C: A product idea and a well-established market.
options.D: A product prototype and patent protection.

questions.question: What is critical for gauging opportunity feasibility in the market?

options.C: Analyzing technology and market factors together.

questions.question: Why is safeguarding intellectual property assets important early in the innovation process?

options.A: To prevent competitors from entering the market.
options.B: To secure funding for further development.
options.C: To ensure the technology is commercially viable.
options.D: To have the option to apply for patents later.

questions.question: What does the prototyping phase of product development entail?

options.A: Launching the product to the market.
options.B: Testing the product with potential customers.

questions.question: What is the significance of field testing in the commercialization process?

options.A: It ensures the product is patented.
options.B: It determines the market feasibility of the product.

questions.question: What are the three basic launch strategies available to inventors and innovators?

options.A: Developing a prototype, seeking investors, and marketing.
options.B: Licensing, selling, and starting a company.

questions.question: What does developing the business plan involve?

options.B: Setting up the legal structure and negotiating with investors.
options.C: Preparing financial statements and industry analyses.
options.D: Building the product infrastructure and securing patents.

questions.question: Why is management expertise crucial during the start-up of a business?
What is the essence of entrepreneurship?

options.B: Recognizing or creating opportunities and commercializing them.

questions.question: What distinguishes an opportunity from an idea?

options.A: An idea is tangible, whereas an opportunity is intangible.
options.B: An idea is a representation of something known, while an opportunity is a favorable set of circumstances.
options.C: An idea is created, whereas an opportunity is recognized.
options.D: An idea is market-driven, whereas an opportunity is technology-driven.

questions.question: When does opportunity recognition occur?

options.A: When there is a surplus of ideas.
options.C: When entrepreneurs possess relevant skills and industry experience.

questions.question: What characterizes an indeterminate problem?

options.B: It produces different answers that can be identified.
options.C: It requires comprehensive information for the correct solution.
options.D: It involves using a specific formula to find a single correct answer.

questions.question: How does divergence differ from convergence in problem solving?

options.A: Divergence generates many ideas, while convergence focuses on narrowing down options.
options.B: Divergence relies on critical thinking, while convergence encourages creativity.
options.C: Divergence is used for deterministic problems, while convergence is used for random problems.
options.D: Divergence leads to the most practical solutions, while convergence explores all possibilities.

questions.question: In what scenario is divergence not typically needed?
What is the primary focus during the convergence phase of problem-solving?
Which problem-solving technique involves brainstorming sessions?
What is the purpose of convergence in problem solving?

options.A: To generate a wide range of potential solutions.
options.B: To critically assess options and select the best solution.
options.C: To explore various scenarios and outcomes.
options.D: To encourage creative thinking and brainstorming.

questions.question: Which type of problem requires extensive exploration of potential strategies and comprehensive information?
What are some examples of unexpected occurrences that can lead to entrepreneurial opportunities?
How can discrepancies between assumptions and reality contribute to entrepreneurial opportunities?

options.B: By challenging established norms and practices.

questions.question: Why is it important for entrepreneurs to study industry or market demographics?

options.B: To adapt to changing consumer preferences and behaviors.

questions.question: How can entrepreneurs leverage changes in assumptions and beliefs?

options.C: By challenging conventional wisdom and innovating.
options.D: By relying solely on existing knowledge.

questions.question: What role do government agencies play in providing entrepreneurial opportunities?

options.A: They offer financial grants to entrepreneurs.
options.B: They conduct market research and develop business strategies.
options.C: They publish requests for proposals (RFPs) and license technologies.
options.D: They provide consumer feedback and product testing.

questions.question: How can entrepreneurs benefit from dormant patents or trademarks?

options.A: By disregarding them and focusing on new innovations.
options.B: By selling them to competitors for profit.
options.C: By finding new value and commercializing them.

questions.question: What sources can entrepreneurs utilize to find new opportunities?

options.A: Government agencies and trade associations only.
options.C: Internet resources and direct mail solicitation only.
options.D: A variety of sources including government agencies, trade associations, internet resources, and more.

questions.question: Why is it important for entrepreneurs to engage with customers?

options.A: To maintain secrecy about their products or services.
options.C: To understand customer needs and pain points.
options.D: To avoid market research and analysis.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of mapping the value chain in an industry?

options.D: To learn how the industry operates and identify potential opportunities.

questions.question: Where can entrepreneurs find opportunities from dormant patents or trademarks?

options.D: A variety of sources including government agencies, trade associations, internet resources, and more.

questions.question: What distinguishes the activities of developing a technology and launching a technology company?

options.B: The focus on research and development.
options.C: The need for different skill sets and experiences.

questions.question: Why is it essential for entrepreneurs to conduct a feasibility analysis before starting a technology business?

options.A: To determine the potential profits of the business.
options.B: To assess the demand for the product or service.
options.C: To identify the skills required for business operations.
options.D: To understand the regulatory requirements of the industry.

questions.question: What factors are typically assessed during a feasibility analysis?

options.D: Market size, capital requirements, and team composition.

questions.question: Why is identifying customer benefits crucial in preparing an invention for market introduction?

options.B: To understand the technical specifications of the product.
options.C: To align the product features with customer needs and preferences.
options.D: To ensure compliance with intellectual property laws.

questions.question: What is the purpose of conducting a feasibility analysis?

options.D: To assess the viability of a technology business idea.

questions.question: Why is it important for entrepreneurs to develop a clear and concise concept statement for their business?

options.C: To demonstrate an understanding of the market and business potential.
options.D: To conceal business strategies from competitors.

questions.question: What are the four elements incorporated in a business concept?

options.A: Product, employee, sales strategy, and distribution channel.
options.B: Technical specifications, market analysis, financial projections, and risk management.
options.C: Product or service, customer definition, value proposition, and distribution channel.
options.D: Research and development, marketing, supply chain, and customer service.

questions.question: What is the benefit of devising a concise concept statement for a business?

options.C: To simplify communication and presentation of the business proposition.

questions.question: How does understanding customer benefits contribute to market success?

options.B: By aligning product features with customer needs and preferences.

questions.question: What analogy does the text use to describe the process of conducting a feasibility analysis?
